xxl.core.collections
Class ReversedList<E>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          xxl.core.collections.ReversedList<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements the list is able to store.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<E>, Collection<E>, List<E>
public class ReversedList<E>
extends AbstractList<E>

The class provides a reversed list. The list to reverse is internally stored and the indexed access methods add, get, set and remove are implemented. Everytime one of the implemented methods is called on this list the specified index is recalculated and a corresponding method is called on the internally stored list. The iterators returned by the iterator and listIterator methods are also reversed.

The performance of the reversed list depends on the internally stored list that is specified when the reversed list is constructed.

Usage example (1). 

     // create a new list
 
     List<Integer> list = new ArrayList<Integer>();
 
     // insert the Integers between 0 and 19 into the list
 
     for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++)
         list.add(new Integer(i));
 
     // create a new reversed list with the given list
 
     ReversedList<Integer> reversedList = new ReversedList<Integer>(list);
 
     // print all elements of the reversed list
 
     for (int i = 0; i < reversedList.size(); i++)
         System.out.println(reversedList.get(i));

See Also:
AbstractList, List

add

public void add(int index,
                E object)
         throws ClassCastException,
                IllegalArgumentException,
                UnsupportedOperationException
Inserts the specified element at the specified position in this reversed list. Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (adds one to their indices).

Specified by:

remove

public E remove(int index)
         throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
Removes the element at the specified position in this reversed list. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices). Returns the element that was removed from the list. This method is equivalent to the call of list.remove(list.size()-1-index).

Specified by:
remove in interface List<E>
Overrides:
remove in class AbstractList<E>
Parameters:
index - the index of the element to remove.
Returns:
the element previously at the specified position.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size()).

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a ReversedList. It can also be used to test the functionality of a ReversedList.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
